column5: We returned yesterday. The weather was not pleasant. Cold, windy and rainy much of the time. I caught 6 smallmouth 18+ inches and many 17 inchers. Total numbers were not there this year. No problem catching walleye. Largest I caught was 25 inches. Largest in the group was 27 inches. Not a good size year for trophy walleye, but many in the 16-21 inch size. Did not see many perch this year. Largest pike was 41 inches and largest muskie while fishing for pike was 47 inches. Hope everyone has better weather and has good fishing. Donhttp://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0263.jpghttp://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0256.jpghttp://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0245.jpghttp://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...g?t=1244408534http://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0270.jpg

Don, Sorry the weather did not cooperate for you guys this year. That's why I gave up going that early several years ago. Don't get me wrong, as you know if you can catch the weather good this early the fishing can be outstanding. I know you like fishing for the smallies, the sweet spot for me has always been 40-50 days after ice-out on the big lake. Leaving June 26th for a week this year, can't wait. Are you going back up this year?
Hi DonC, Very nice picturesThank you,Larry Mac
Don, Nice pics. Where did you get the Nortern Pike? I see fast water in the background. Heading up Labor Day weekend out of nw suburbs of Chicago. Already went through tackle box twice. Randy

Randy, Using sauger jigs we buy in TN, one was caught at the Dalles Rapids and the 41 inch pike at the Throat Rapids. Sauger jigs are 1-1/4 ounce jigs, that you can see in the pike's mouth. We hammer the walleye and sauger with them, fished with a minnow or soft plastic, letting the treble trailer hook trail free. I caught the 25 inch walleye and lost another about that size on one. The guides up there are incredulous that they work and out fish smaller jigs. Don

Here is the 41 inch Pike at the Throat Rapids.http://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0280.jpg This is what I caught to win at least one category......a real "trophy" at the Throat Rapidshttp://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0278.jpg As recorded with a new category at the "bottom" of the board. http://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0290.jpg Don PS: If you see this guy, do not let him in your boat!!!http://i193.photobucket.com/albums/z...l/IMG_0272.jpg

Hey DonC,A friend of mine who is a guide that works with that ugly guy handling the tiller in one of your photos said I should try and get in contact with you. He thinks we may live very close together but I don't know. I have been fishing Minaki for a number of years. Look forward to hearing from you.PCW
PCW, See the latest PM. It would be great to see other's from TN up there. Probably will not make another trip this year. Don
